dk.itst.oiosaml.sp.service.session
Interface SessionHandler

All Known Implementing Classes:
JdbcSessionHandler, SingleVMSessionHandler
public interface SessionHandler

Handle session state across requests and instances.

Due to SOAP Logout, it is not possible to store all state in the HTTP session. Instead, implementations of this interface handle session state, primarily based on the HTTP session.

Implementations are expected to be thread-safe, and should not store any instance state, as a new instance will be created for every request.

See Also:
SessionHandlerFactory

setAssertion

void setAssertion(String sessionId,
                  OIOAssertion assertion)
                  throws IllegalArgumentException
Associate an assertion with a given session.

Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - If the assertion is being replayed. Implementations must check that the assertion id has not been seen before.

isLoggedIn

boolean isLoggedIn(String sessionId)
Returns:
true if the session is logged in and has a non expired assertion, false otherwise.

getAssertion

OIOAssertion getAssertion(String sessionId)
Returns:
The Assertion associated with the session. null if there is no assertion.

getRelatedSessionId

Parameters:

cleanup

void cleanup(long requestIdsCleanupDelay,
             long sessionCleanupDelay)
Clean stored ids and sessions.

Parameters:
requestIdsCleanupDelay - Milliseconds to store assertion ids for replay prevention.
sessionCleanupDelay - Milliseconds to store session data before purging (in case logout has not been called).

resetReplayProtection

void resetReplayProtection(int maxNum)
Set the max number of assertion ids to track for replay protection, and reset the cache.

Parameters:
maxNum -

saveRequest

String saveRequest(Request request)
Save information about a request. The information saved can be retrieved later on using getRequest to replay the request after the user has been authenticated.

Returns:
A unique opaque string, no more than 72 characters long.
